page.title: 01Gazeteer D Block OS 05480210
page.content:
The area is extensively covered by a thick layer (up to 20m in depth) of boulder clay over chalk.
The land is farmed mainly for cerial crops, barley and wheat. Rape is also grown, particularly in the north. There are several pea fields in the centre of the area. Very few farm animals are to be seen.
The farms are large and settlement is sparce. Churchgate Street, with some 300 dwellings and Matching Tye with 100, are the only settlements of any size. With easy access to the M11, which bisects the area from north to south, house prices are rising.
There are very few amenities. Residents are heavily dependent on Harlow which lies to the west.
